# Best streaming deals and bundles in September 2024

Written by 【103†Lillian Brown】; edited by 【104†Brendan Griffiths】 

2024-09-06T21:39:44Z

Even if you have a comprehensive cable package, streaming services have become all but necessary to keep up with select sports and original TV shows. Fortunately, there are deals on nearly every streaming service out there, especially when it comes to opting in for an annual plan or bundling multiple services together. Below, we've highlighted all of the best streaming deals and bundles, from Disney to Amazon and everything in between.

While many of these deals are standard, year-round offerings, we'll keep this page updated to include limited-time-only sales so that you'll never miss out on potential savings. This month, we've found some special deals at Paramount+ right in time for the start of the NFL season.

Check out each streaming service's currently available deals below. We've highlighted both standard streaming services and live TV packages, with price comparisons to how much you'd pay per year with a month-to-month plan or how much you'd pay per month without bundling multiple services together. Many of the streamers offer introductory deals, which we've also outlined.

## Paramount+

There are always year-round savings with Paramount+ annual plans compared to paying month-to-month (Essential plans go for $7.99/month, and the With Showtime tier costs $13.99/month), but there's an even stronger deal right now. You can get 50% off of the annual plan, which already offers savings, using the code FALL50. This is a limited-time-only offer available until September 23, and we've broken down exactly what a subscription entails in 【107†our guide】.

【108† †affiliate.insider.com】 

【108† Paramount Plus Essential (Annual Plan) †affiliate.insider.com】 

【108†$29.99†affiliate.insider.com】 $95.88 Save 69%

Users can get major savings on an annual subscription for the next couple of weeks using the promo code FALL50. This will give you a year's worth of CBS and Paramount original on-demand, along with live access to the NFL on CBS. 

【108† View at Paramount Plus †affiliate.insider.com】 

【108† †affiliate.insider.com】 

【108† Paramount Plus with Showtime Annual Plan †affiliate.insider.com】 

【108†$59.99†affiliate.insider.com】 $155.88 Save 62%

From now until September 23, subscribers can get a year of Paramount Plus with Showtime for 50% off the normal annual plan and more than half-off what they'd pay month-to-month each year. This tier means that you can access on-demand content ad-free, as well as CBS live streams. 

【108† View at Paramount Plus †affiliate.insider.com】 

If you just want to stick with a monthly plan, you can head to the 【109†Paramount+ website†affiliate.insider.com】.

## ESPN+

ESPN+ goes for $10.99 a month, so an annual plan offers some savings if you're planning to keep your subscription for a year. The streaming service is best known for its UFC pay-per-view (PPV) events, which require a subscription and an additional PPV fee. The bundle below offers further discounts when you combine an annual subscription with a PPV purchase. 

【110† †affiliate.insider.com】 

【110† ESPN+ Annual †affiliate.insider.com】 

【110†$109.99†affiliate.insider.com】 $131.88 Save 17%

Get a year's access to ESPN+ for the cost of 10 months. You can stream select games from the ABC and ESPN family, and access PPV events for an additional fee. 

【110† View at ESPN+ †affiliate.insider.com】 

【111† †affiliate.insider.com】 

【111† UFC PPV + Annual ESPN+ Membership (Bundle) †affiliate.insider.com】 

【111†$134.98†affiliate
content.title: Best Streaming Deals and Bundles in September 2024

content.text:
【58†View Deal†disneyplus.bn5x.net】

Sling TV: 【59†Save 50% on your first month of Sling TV†sling-tv.pxf.io】  
Opt for either its Orange or Blue plan (or both) and new and returning customers can currently save 50% on their first month. That brings the price down from $40 to $20 for Orange and down to $22.50 for Blue. Or, if you opt for both, it'll cost $30 for your first month of both the Blue and Orange packages.

【60†View Deal†sling-tv.pxf.io】

[Image 25: Sling TV: Season Pass for NFL and NCAA football]

Sling TV: 【61†Season Pass for NFL and NCAA football†sling-tv.pxf.io】  
Pay for 4 months of Sling TV upfront and the cord cutter says this will save you $92 on going elsewhere to get all your coverage of NFL and NCAA football games this season. Costing $199 total, that's $92 cheaper than the $291 bill for four months subscribing to other streaming services.

【62†View Deal†sling-tv.pxf.io】

[Image 26: Sling TV: Free Premium Pass with base plans]

Sling TV: 【61†Free Premium Pass with base plans†sling-tv.pxf.io】  
Sign up to one of Sling's base plans (Blue or Orange) and you'll get a month of Premium Pass for free. Premium Pass throws together a number of streaming services, including Paramount Plus with Showtime, AMC Plus, MGM Plus, and STARZ. Usually worth $32.99 a month, that's a whole lot of extra on-demand content. While you won't benefit from the 50% off the base plan with this offer, you can claim and get $10 off whichever package you choose.

【63†View Deal†sling-tv.pxf.io】

[Image 27: Sling TV: $10 $5 for your first month of Paramount Plus with Showtime]

Sling TV: 【61†$10 $5 for your first month of Paramount Plus with Showtime†sling-tv.pxf.io】  
Bump up your on-demand content and subscribe to Sling with the Paramount Plus with Showtime plan as an add-on. Currently you can sign up and pay just $5 for your first month, saving 50% on the premium Paramount Plus plan.

【64†View Deal†sling-tv.pxf.io】

[Image 28: AMC Plus: $8.99 $5 for your first month]

AMC Plus: 【61†$8.99 $5 for your first month†sling-tv.pxf.io】  
Save on your first month of AMC Plus and stream originals like The Walking Dead: Dead City and Interview with the Vampire when you sign up through Sling TV. No need to spend a cent on the cable cutter itself, you can simply sample AMC Plus' library off TV shows and movies, featuring hits from SHUDDER, Sundance, and more.

【65†View Deal†sling-tv.pxf.io】

With a choice of three plans, get gritty Warner Bros. movies and TV shows, as well as easy entertainment from Discovery's library of reality TV in one. Starting from $9.99 a month for its With Ads plan, why not subscribe straight up for a whole year and save up to 20% across all three plans available.

Philo: 【72†7-day free trial†philo.sjv.io】  
One of the cheapest cable alternatives, Philo offers a niche package of cable channels, including: Comedy Central, Logo, Hallmark, VH1, and MTV. Costing just $25 a month, new customers can enjoy a 7-day free trial period to test out the service and see if it's the one for you.

【73†View Deal†philo.sjv.io】

Hulu: 【74†30 day free trial with With-Ads and Ad-Free plans†click.linksynergy.com】  
New and eligible returning customers can try out Hulu's on-demand plans with the 30-day Hulu free trial. Thereafter pay $7.99 a month for its With-Ads plan, or $17.99 a month to cut out the commercials. A free trial has also returned for its 【75†Hulu with Live TV】 plan. New subscribers can try the cord cutting service for 3 days.

【76†View Deal†click.linksynergy.com】

Apple TV Plus: 【77†7-day free trial†tv.apple.com】

content.title: Best streaming deals September 2024: $1.99 Disney Plus deal is back! | TechRadar

content.text:
With the Disney Bundle Trio Basic, you can combine Disney+ Basic (regularly $7.99 a month) with 【32†Hulu】 (basic version with ads, regularly $7.99 a month) and 【89†ESPN+】 (regularly $10.99 a month). That’s a $26.97 value for just $14.99 a month. You could upgrade your internet speed with the extra green. With all that streaming, you might need it.

There are several ways you can customize the Disney Bundle. If you’re not interested in ESPN+, you can get the Duo Basic, which only includes ad-supported versions of Hulu and Disney+, for $9.99 a month.

If you want to go all-out and do away with pesky ads, you can upgrade to Duo Premium, which bundles ad-free versions of Disney+ and Hulu for $19.99 a month. You can also add ad-supported ESPN+ to the bundle for a total of $24.99 a month. Unfortunately, you can’t bundle in an ad-free version of ESPN+.

There are also variations on this bundle that can save you money on ad-free Hulu or Hulu + Live TV—check out our 【90†Hulu Bundles guide】 for all the discount streaming deets.

【58†View Disney+ plans†go.cabletv.com】

## Best deal for live TV streaming: Sling TV with discounted first month

【60† †go.cabletv.com】 

【59†Editorial rating (3.7/5)】

【60†View plans†go.cabletv.com】

【31†Read full review】 

#### Pro

  * Free and discounted gear

#### Con

  * Limited local channels

【31†Sling TV】 is one of the loudest voices in live TV streaming. But it doesn’t just advertise hard—it’s also willing to give you 【91†free stuff】 to cut that cable (or satellite beam).

If you prepay for 4 months of Sling TV Season Pass (which includes Sling’s Orange + Blue tier and the Sports Extra plan), you’ll save $92 and be able to stream both NFL and NCAA football games.

For a limited time, new Sling TV customers can enjoy half off their first month of Sling Blue, Orange, or Orange & Blue.

Get a free month of Premium Pass when you select a Sling base service. With Premium Pass you’ll get access to Paramount+ with Showtime, AMC+, STARZ, and MGM+ with no contract required.

【60†View Sling TV plans†go.cabletv.com】

## Best deal for Apple fans: Free Apple TV+ with Apple product purchase

【61† †go.cabletv.com】 

【59†Editorial rating (4/5)】

Price:

Regularly $9.99/mo.

Feature #1:

Apple TV+ originals 

Feature #2:

Free for 3 mos.

【61†View plans†go.cabletv.com】

【92†Read full review】 

#### Pro

  * Free Apple TV+

#### Con

  * Limited time offer

Apple lovers rarely need an excuse to visit an Apple Store, but not all of them are convinced that they should drop $9.99 a month on its content-loaded 【92†Apple TV+】 streaming service. Conundrum solved: purchase a new iPhone, MacBook, iPad, or Apple TV, and Apple will throw in three months of Apple TV+ at zero cost. Ultimately, that’s an annual savings of $29.97.

With it, you can check out Apple TV+ original series like Ted Lasso, Mythic Quest: Raven’s Banquet, and The Morning Show. When does Apple give away anything for free?

【61†View Apple TV+ plans†go.cabletv.com】

## Best Amazon Prime Video deal for students: Free and discounted Amazon Prime membership

【59†Editorial rating (4/5)】

Free (6 mos.)

Feature #1:

Access to Prime Video 

Feature #2:

$7.49/mo. (or $69.00/yr.) after trial

【62†View plans †www.amazon.com】 

【37†Read full review】 

#### Pro

  * 12 months of free Amazon Prime membership

#### Con

  * Limited availability

Amazon’s Prime Student program offers a free six-month trial of Prime membership for higher education students, and a discounted rate of $7.49 a month (or $69.00 a year—you save even more money by paying for 12 months in advance) after the trial. This also gives you access to 【37†Prime Video】 at no extra charge.

After four years, or the end of your college studies, whichever comes first, your Prime membership will revert to its standard rate: $14.99 a month, or $139.00 a year.

【62†Amazon Prime plans†www.amazon.com】

【63†View plans †go.cabletv.com】 

【32†Read full review】 

#### Pro

  * 75% monthly savings

#### Con

  * Not available for all colleges

College students 18 and over can subscribe to 【32†Hulu】’s basic, ad-supported plan for just $1.99 a month, a huge savings over the usual $7.99 a month.

To be eligible, you’ll need to be verified as a student through Sheer ID. The deal isn’t available to all colleges, and it’s only active for the time you’re a verifiable student.

【63†View Hulu plans†go.cabletv.com】

## What to look for in streaming TV packages and deals

Before you sign up for that deal, check into these details first:

### How long the deal lasts

Once your deal’s time is up, you’ll be charged the regular rate for the service. The Disney+ bundle has no expiration date (yet), but some plans are limited time only—after which, you’ll be charged the normal price each month.

### Hidden fees

Sometimes a provider will sneak in some extra fees that can eat into your overall savings. It’s a strain on the eyes, but always read the fine print before you sign up.

### Current customer eligibility

Most of the deals we’ve covered here are aimed at new customers as an incentive to sign up, but current customers can sometimes get in on them too. If you’re a customer in good standing with your provider, contact customer service and simply ask if you can take advantage of the same offer as a new customer. In most cases, they’ll work with you to keep you as customer.

## What are the best streaming TV deals?

[Image 10: Image]

Disney Plus: bundles with other services  
While there's no great Disney/ESPN/Hulu bundle in the UK (due to the latter two streaming services not existing in the country), there are two ways to get cheaper subscriptions. O2 offers £2 off per month for half a year if you subscribe to one of its plans — 【57†check out that deal here†www.awin1.com】 — while Samsung offers 6 months of Disney Plus for free if you own one of its Galaxy phones, and you can claim that by 【58†following this link†www.awin1.com】.

[Image 11: Paramount Plus: 7-day free trial Sky TV bundle]

Paramount Plus: 【35†7-day free trial】  
If you're interested in signing up for Paramount Plus, the closest thing it has to a deal is a seven-day free trial which gives you a week of free access to its library. To double it, you can also try the trial of the Paramount Plus 【35†Prime Video channel】.  
Sky TV bundle  
If you're a Sky TV customer, you get Paramount Plus for free, and you can check out the 【59†Sky TV bundles†go.redirectingat.com】 here.

【35†View Deal】

[Image 12: Discovery Plus: seven-day trial or bundles with other services]

Discovery Plus: 【60†seven-day trial†get.discoveryplus.com】 or bundles with other services  
Discovery Plus offers a 【60†seven-day trial†get.discoveryplus.com】 of its Entertainment tier (sans sports) which usually costs £3.99 per month. Also Vodafone members can get 6 months for free — 【61†details here†www.awin1.com】 — while Sky Q customers get 12 months by 【62†going here†go.redirectingat.com】.

【60†View Deal†get.discoveryplus.com】

### Streaming deals FAQs 

### What is the best streaming deal?

Streaming service deals come and go — if they didn't, they wouldn't be a 'deal', just a regular price. But there's always one or two standout deals.

In the US, the 【63†Disney Bundle】 (Hulu, Disney Plus and ESPN Plus) is a great option for people who want all three services. The cost, $13.99, is less than you'd pay for any two of the services and gets you a third totally free as well.

In the UK, it's usually mobile operator bundles that offer the best deals, so when you're buying a new phone contract, you can often use that to get yourself cheap streaming service subscriptions.

### When do the best streaming deals take place?

Some deals, like bundles and trials, roll all year round. But others only pop up sporadically.

A great time to look for streaming service deals is around Black Friday, which in 2022 falls on Friday 25 November. In previous years, we've seen great discounts on Disney Plus, AMC Plus, Discovery Plus, Hulu and a fair few Prime Video channels.

Certain companies have special 'days' too, like 【64†Disney Plus Day】 and Amazon Prime Day, and we often see discounts on the corresponding services for a limited time.

### What makes a good streaming deal?

When streaming services were new, each offered plenty of deals to try and get you to try this new-fangled way of watching TV. That's not the case anymore, and actual discounts on streaming services are few and far between.

So a "good deal" on a streaming service can be anything that lets you save money, but the most common we see are bundles, that group multiple services in for a lower price. As long as you want all the services, this is a good way to save.

The best deals are the straight-up discounts though, especially on annual subscriptions, as they save you the most amount of cash (as monthly deals only reduce one month's bill).

Today's best Netflix, Apple TV plus, Amazon Prime, Paramount Plus, HBO Max, Disney+ and Hulu deals

[Image 13: Netflix]

【65†Netflix - Standard with ads†www.anrdoezrs.net】

【65† $6.99 /mth†www.anrdoezrs.net】

【65†View Deal†www.an
content.title: Best streaming deals: Hulu, Peacock, Max and more | What to Watch

parts:
The best streaming package deals available right now in September 2024 offer a variety of options depending on your needs:

1. **Disney Bundle**: One of the standout deals is the Disney Bundle, which includes Disney+, Hulu (with ads), and ESPN+ for just $12.99 per month. If you prefer not to include ESPN+, the Duo Basic bundle (Disney+ and Hulu with ads) is available for $9.99 per month. If you want ad-free options, the Duo Premium bundle (Disney+ and Hulu ad-free) is available for $19.99 per month, or you can add ESPN+ to this bundle for $24.99 per month【8†source】.

2. **Paramount+ with Showtime**: Paramount+ is offering a significant discount on their annual plans. With the code FALL50, you can get 50% off an annual plan, making the Essential Plan $29.99 per year and the Paramount+ with Showtime plan $59.99 per year. This deal is available until September 23, 2024【6†source】.

3. **Sling TV**: Sling TV offers a 50% discount on the first month for new subscribers, bringing the cost down to $20 for the Sling Orange plan and $22.50 for the Sling Blue plan. If you subscribe to both, it’s $30 for the first month. Additionally, new subscribers get a free month of the Premium Pass, which includes access to streaming services like Paramount+ with Showtime, AMC+, STARZ, and MGM+【7†source】.

4. **Amazon Prime Video for Students**: If you're a college student, you can get Amazon Prime (including Prime Video) at half price, which is $7.49 per month after a six-month free trial【9†source】.

5. **Apple TV+**: Apple offers three months of Apple TV+ for free with the purchase of a new Apple device (such as an iPhone, MacBook, iPad, or Apple TV). After the free period, it costs $9.99 per month【8†source】.

These deals cater to a wide range of preferences, from discounted bundles to student rates, so you can choose the one that best fits your viewing habits and budget.

Yes, there are some current deals for Max (formerly HBO Max):

1. **Max Annual Plans**: Max offers a discount of up to 20% on its annual plans. You can choose from three different plans:
   - **With Ads Plan**: $9.99 per month or discounted to $99.99 per year (saving about 16% annually).
   - **Ad-Free Plan**: $15.99 per month or discounted to $149.99 per year (saving about 22% annually).
   - **Ultimate Ad-Free Plan**: $19.99 per month or discounted to $199.99 per year (saving about 17% annually).
   
   These plans include access to Warner Bros. movies, HBO originals, and Discovery's library of reality TV【9†source】.

2. **Max Free with Certain Service Subscriptions**: Sometimes, Max is included for free with certain cable or internet provider packages. Check with your provider to see if they offer a bundle that includes Max at no additional cost.

3. **Max with Other Streaming Services**: In some cases, Max can be bundled with other services or devices, such as streaming platforms or smart TV purchases, offering discounted rates or extended trial periods.

These deals can help reduce the cost of Max subscriptions, depending on how you prefer to watch (with or without ads) and if you are interested in other included content like Discovery's shows or Warner Bros. movies.

Currently, there aren't many specific bundled packages directly offering Max (formerly HBO Max) with other streaming services. However, there are a few indirect ways you might get a Max subscription bundled or at a discounted rate:

1. **AT&T Wireless and Internet Plans**: Some AT&T customers can get Max included for free with select wireless, internet, and TV plans. This is a common perk that has been offered for some time, so if you're an AT&T customer or considering switching, it's worth checking if your plan includes Max.

2. **Certain Cable or Satellite TV Providers**: Some cable and satellite providers, like DirecTV and Comcast, may offer Max as part of their premium packages. These bundles can often include other premium networks (like STARZ, Showtime, and Cinemax) along with Max.

3. **Bundles with Streaming Devices**: Occasionally, there are promotions where you can get a Max subscription when you purchase a certain streaming device, like a Roku or Apple TV, though this tends to vary by retailer and specific promotions.

4. **Discovery+ and Max Merge Plan**: Since Max includes Discovery's content, the plan effectively bundles Discovery+ and Max content together, but it's not offered as a separate service bundle at this time. However, you get access to both libraries if you subscribe to Max's Ultimate Ad-Free plan.

5. **Add-Ons Through Other Services**: You can often add Max as a premium channel through services like Amazon Prime Video, Hulu, or YouTube TV, which might occasionally offer introductory discounts or special deals on the Max subscription.

While there aren't direct bundled packages with Max and other streaming services currently available, keeping an eye on promotions from your wireless provider, cable service, or streaming device retailer could offer a way to get Max at a discounted rate or as part of a bundle.
how much is hulu and max per month

Here are the current monthly prices for Hulu and Max:

### **Hulu Pricing:**
1. **Hulu (With Ads):** $7.99 per month.
2. **Hulu (No Ads):** $17.99 per month.
3. **Hulu + Live TV (With Ads):** $76.99 per month (includes access to Disney+ and ESPN+ with ads).
4. **Hulu (No Ads) + Live TV:** $89.99 per month (also includes access to Disney+ and ESPN+ with ads)【9†source】.

### **Max (formerly HBO Max) Pricing:**
1. **Max With Ads:** $9.99 per month.
2. **Max Ad-Free:** $15.99 per month.
3. **Max Ultimate Ad-Free:** $19.99 per month【9†source】.

### **Bundled Options:**
There are no direct bundles that specifically combine Hulu and Max, but you can subscribe to both separately or consider a Hulu + Live TV plan that includes Disney+ and ESPN+ for a comprehensive streaming experience.

# PRICE HIKE: Disney+, Hulu and ESPN+ Subscriptions Will Cost More in 2024

Written by 【142†Nick Cole】 | August 6th, 2024 

  * 【0†Home】
  * 【84† Streaming TV 】

Advertisement

Stop me if you’ve heard this one before, 【89†cord cutters】: “The price of your favorite 【85†streaming service】 is going up!”

Disney just announced that it will be raising subscription prices later this year. And, unfortunately, this is a wide-reaching hike that will impact a bunch of subscribers.

The upcoming changes will include increases to the following services and bundles:

  * Disney+
  * Hulu (on-demand)
  * Hulu + Live TV
  * ESPN+
  * The Disney Bundle

Unfortunately, both ad-supported and ad-free tiers will be impacted.

Let’s take a look at what we know so far.

* * *

## Disney+, Hulu and ESPN+ Will Increase Subscription Prices in October

The prices for 【143†Disney+】, 【144†Hulu】, 【144†Hulu + Live TV】 and 【145†ESPN+†go.web.plus.espn.com】 subscriptions will increase by at least $1 per month. Most of the increases are at least $2, though, and the 【96†Hulu + Live TV】 increase is a gut punch at $6 per month. That means the cheapest you’ll be able to stream live TV via Hulu is now $82.99 per month!

Disney will make the price increases effective October 17, 2024.

Here’s a breakdown of the existing and upcoming prices for each impacted service:

Subscription Tier Current Monthly Price New Price Effective Oct. 17   
Hulu with Ads$7.99$9.99   
Hulu without Ads$17.99$18.99   
Hulu + Live TV (with VOD ads)$76.99$82.99   
Hulu + Live TV (w/o VOD ads)$89.99$95.99   
Disney+ Basic$7.99$9.99   
Disney+ Premium$13.99$15.99   
ESPN+$10.99$11.99   
Disney Bundle Trio Basic$14.99$16.99   
Disney Bundle Trio Premium$24.99$26.99  

As a small consolation to this bad news, it was also announced that ABC News Live will be streamed on Disney+ beginning in September.

content.title: PRICE HIKE: Disney+, Hulu and ESPN+ Subscriptions Will Cost More in 2024

parts:
The prices for both Hulu and Max are set to increase soon:

### **Hulu Price Increases:**
- **Hulu (With Ads):** Increasing from $7.99 to **$9.99 per month**.
- **Hulu (No Ads):** Increasing from $17.99 to **$18.99 per month**.
- **Hulu + Live TV (With Ads):** Increasing from $76.99 to **$82.99 per month**.
- **Hulu + Live TV (No Ads):** Increasing from $89.99 to **$95.99 per month**.
These new prices will take effect on **October 17, 2024**【23†source】.

### **Max Price Increases:**
- **Max Ad-Free Plan:** Increasing from $15.99 to **$16.99 per month**.
- **Max Ultimate Ad-Free Plan:** Increasing from $19.99 to **$20.99 per month**.
These new prices are already effective as of **September 17, 2024**【23†source】.

If you're subscribed to these services, be aware of these changes and consider adjusting your plans accordingly.
